{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3304352,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-07T21:09:13.480Z","cooked":"

Hello FRC Community.

We saw that theres new releases for the limelight, however after installing all of them we ran into a problem. When opening BalenaEtcher and trying to select a target, both our limelight 2+ and 3 don’t seen to appear in BalenaEtcher. We’re connected to USB and all, but for some reason it just doesn’t appear.

Have you tried a different cable? The one you have may be a charging only one.

Do you have all the correct drivers? I had the same issue and it was resolved when I downloaded the drivers necessary to write to the Limelight. It should be on the setup page on the documentation.

This is typically the issue, just ensure you have the drivers they indicate in the documentation.

I recently had this problem, it’s a dumb problem. First, unplug your limelight from everything and then connect to it via USB C cable from your laptop. THEN, once the limelight has booted up (you can tell based one of its lights turning green) you launch Etcher.

I originally was using a Windows 11 Pro system and could not load
the photonvision image file photonvision-v2025.3.1-linuxarm64_limelight2.img.xz for my limelight2 to upgrade
it to the 2025 version. The load using Balenaetcher was
Error(0,H.requestMetadata) is not a function. I tried multiple cables and different
plug in procedures and Windows 11 would not work. I saw a thread to use
Windows 10 and the USB driver download and Balenaetcher would load
the file fine and the Limelight2 would be seen “compute module” and the download went fine. I had even tried the Raspberry Pi Imager. Thanks for the help!
